context.title: SACM Argument
context.description: This element represents an argument node in a claim-argument-evidence notation argument. A parent claim captures the intention of what the argument is meant to accomplish.

context.title: SACM Claim
context.description: This element represents a claim in a claim-argument-evidence argument. Use these nodes to identify a starting point for what the argument is intending to show.

context.title: SACM Solution
context.description: This element represents an evidence node in a claim-argument-evidence argument. Evidence is meant to fulfill its parent claim.

context.title: SACM Assumption
context.description: This element represents an assumption in a claim-argument-evidence argument. Assumption nodes capture information necessary to support the argument, but which may be challenged.

context.title: SACM Justification
context.description: This element represents a justification in a claim-argument-evidence argument. A justification explains why a particular strategy has been adopted.

context.title: SACM Context
context.description: This element represents a context in a claim-argument-evidence argument. A context node attaches contextual information to another node to explain its relevance.
